name: Amazon RDS Essentials
description: Key features and configurations for Amazon RDS relational databases on AWS.

cards.front: Your development team wants to reduce time spent on managing database infrastructure like patching, backups, and scaling. Which AWS service best addresses this need?
cards.back: Amazon RDS is the best fit, as it offloads infrastructure management tasks like provisioning, patching, backups, and scaling.
cards.example: A healthcare startup uses Amazon RDS to host their PostgreSQL database so they can focus on patient data features instead of DB maintenance.
cards.subject: Amazon Relational Database Service

cards.front: A critical compliance policy requires you to retain database backups for over one year. What backup feature in Amazon RDS should you use?
cards.back: Use manual snapshots, which allow indefinite retention and are managed manually via the RDS console.
cards.example: A financial institution stores monthly manual snapshots of its SQL Server database to comply with 7-year retention policies.
cards.subject: Amazon Relational Database Service

cards.front: Your application requires automatic failover support in case of database outages. Which Amazon RDS feature should you enable?
cards.back: Enable Amazon RDS Multi-AZ to maintain a synchronous standby replica in another Availability Zone with automatic failover.
cards.example: An e-commerce app uses RDS Multi-AZ for its MySQL database to maintain availability during outages.
cards.subject: Amazon Relational Database Service

cards.front: You're designing a secure architecture where only backend EC2 instances should access the database. How do you restrict network access in Amazon RDS?
cards.back: Use private subnets in your DB subnet group and apply security groups and network ACLs to control inbound traffic.
cards.example: A SaaS platform places its RDS PostgreSQL database in private subnets, accessible only to application servers via security group rules.
cards.subject: Amazon Relational Database Service

cards.front: Which Amazon RDS engine should you choose if you want a cloud-native relational database with better durability and performance than MySQL?
cards.back: Use Amazon Aurora, which is a MySQL- and PostgreSQL-compatible cloud-native database optimized for performance and durability.
cards.example: A logistics company migrates to Amazon Aurora MySQL to benefit from faster performance and better availability.
